keywords.name: Flying
keywords.summary: Can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach
keywords.rules_text: This creature can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach. It's one of the most common evasion abilities in Magic.
keywords.reminder_text: (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.9a Flying is an evasion ability.
702.9b A creature with flying can't be blocked except by creatures with flying and/or reach.
702.9c Multiple instances of flying on the same creature are redundant.

keywords.name: Reach
keywords.summary: Can block creatures with flying
keywords.rules_text: This creature can block creatures with flying. Reach is typically found on green creatures as their answer to flying.
keywords.reminder_text: (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.17a Reach is a static ability.
702.17b A creature with flying can be blocked by a creature with reach.
702.17c Multiple instances of reach on the same creature are redundant.

keywords.name: Deathtouch
keywords.summary: Any amount of damage dealt to a creature is lethal
keywords.rules_text: Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it. Even 1 damage from a deathtouch source kills any creature, regardless of its toughness.
keywords.reminder_text: (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.2a Deathtouch is a static ability.
702.2b A creature dealt damage by a source with deathtouch is destroyed as a state-based action.
702.2c Damage from a source with deathtouch follows all normal rules for damage.
keywords.tips: Deathtouch + First Strike is very powerful: your creature deals lethal damage before the opponent's creature can hit back.

keywords.name: First Strike
keywords.summary: Deals combat damage before creatures without first strike
keywords.rules_text: This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. If the first strike damage destroys the blocking/blocked creature, that creature never deals its damage.
keywords.reminder_text: (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.7a First strike is a static ability that modifies the rules for the combat damage step.
702.7b During the combat damage step, if at least one attacking or blocking creature has first strike, creatures without first strike don't assign combat damage during that step. Instead, a second combat damage step occurs.

keywords.name: Double Strike
keywords.summary: Deals combat damage twice: first strike and normal
keywords.rules_text: This creature deals combat damage twice - once during the first strike damage step and once during regular combat damage. It effectively deals double its power in damage.
keywords.reminder_text: (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.4a Double strike is a static ability that modifies the rules for the combat damage step.
702.4b If a creature has double strike, it deals damage during both the first-strike and normal combat damage steps.

keywords.name: Trample
keywords.summary: Excess combat damage carries over to the defending player
keywords.rules_text: If this creature would deal enough combat damage to destroy all blockers, the remaining damage is dealt to the defending player or planeswalker. Without trample, all damage goes to blockers even if it's more than needed.
keywords.reminder_text: (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.19a Trample is a static ability that modifies the rules for assigning an attacking creature's combat damage.
702.19b The attacking creature's controller must assign lethal damage to all blockers before assigning any to the defending player.
keywords.tips: Trample + Deathtouch is devastating: only 1 damage needs to be assigned to each blocker (since it's lethal), and the rest tramples over.

keywords.name: Vigilance
keywords.summary: Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap
keywords.rules_text: This creature doesn't tap when it attacks. It can attack and still be available to block on the opponent's turn.
keywords.reminder_text: (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.20a Vigilance is a static ability that modifies the rules for the declare attackers step.
702.20b Multiple instances of vigilance on the same creature are redundant.

keywords.name: Haste
keywords.summary: Can attack and tap abilities the turn it enters
keywords.rules_text: This creature can attack and use tap abilities the turn it enters the battlefield. Normally, creatures have 'summoning sickness' and can't do these things until your next turn.
keywords.reminder_text: (This creature can attack and tap as soon as it comes under your control.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.10a Haste is a static ability.
702.10b If a creature has haste, it can attack and tap even if it hasn't been controlled by its controller continuously since their most recent turn began.

keywords.name: Lifelink
keywords.summary: Damage dealt by this creature also gains you that much life
keywords.rules_text: Whenever this creature deals damage, you gain that much life. This includes combat damage and damage from abilities.
keywords.reminder_text: (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.15a Lifelink is a static ability.
702.15b Damage dealt by a source with lifelink causes that source's controller to gain that much life (in addition to any other results that damage causes).
702.15c Multiple instances of lifelink are redundant.

keywords.name: Menace
keywords.summary: Can only be blocked by two or more creatures
keywords.rules_text: This creature can't be blocked by a single creature. The defending player must assign at least two blockers, making it harder to defend against.
keywords.reminder_text: (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.110a Menace is an evasion ability.
702.110b A creature with menace can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.

keywords.name: Defender
keywords.summary: This creature can't attack
keywords.rules_text: This creature can't attack. It can only block. Cards with defender often have high toughness or useful abilities to compensate.
keywords.reminder_text: (This creature can't attack.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.3a Defender is a static ability.
702.3b A creature with defender can't attack.

keywords.name: Hexproof
keywords.summary: Can't be targeted by opponents' spells and abilities
keywords.rules_text: This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control. Your own spells can still target it. Note: Board wipes and effects that don't target still work.
keywords.reminder_text: (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.11a Hexproof is a static ability.
702.11b A permanent with hexproof can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.
keywords.tips: Hexproof doesn't protect against: board wipes (Wrath of God), sacrifice effects (Liliana's -2), or effects that don't target.

keywords.name: Ward
keywords.summary: Opponents must pay extra to target this permanent
keywords.rules_text: Whenever this permanent becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter that spell or ability unless its controller pays the ward cost.
keywords.reminder_text: (Whenever this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays [cost].)
keywords.comprehensive_rules: 702.21a Ward is a triggered ability. Ward [cost] means "Whenever this permanent becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter that spell or ability unless that player pays [cost]."

keywords.name: Indestructible
keywords.summary: Can't be destroyed by damage or 'destroy' effects
keywords.rules_text: This permanent can't be destroyed. Damage doesn't destroy it, and 'destroy' effects don't work. However, it can still be exiled, bounced, sacrificed, or given -X/-X until it has 0 or less toughness.
keywords.reminder_text: (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy this.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.12a Indestructible is a static ability.
702.12b A permanent with indestructible can't be destroyed. Such permanents aren't destroyed by lethal damage, and they ignore the state-based action that destroys creatures with lethal damage.
keywords.tips: Ways to deal with indestructible: Exile effects, -X/-X effects, sacrifice, bounce, or reducing toughness to 0.

keywords.name: Flash
keywords.summary: Can be cast any time you could cast an instant
keywords.rules_text: You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant, including during your opponent's turn or in response to other spells. This is especially powerful for creatures, letting you ambush attackers.
keywords.reminder_text: (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.8a Flash is a static ability that functions in any zone from which you could play the card it's on.
702.8b "Flash" means "You may play this card any time you could cast an instant."
keywords.tips: Flash creatures are great for blocking attackers your opponent thought were getting through, or holding up mana for counterspells.

keywords.name: Equip
keywords.summary: Attach this Equipment to target creature you control
keywords.rules_text: Pay the equip cost to attach this Equipment to target creature you control. You can only equip as a sorcery (on your main phase when the stack is empty). Equipment stays on the battlefield when the creature dies.
keywords.reminder_text: (Equip [cost]: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.6a Equip is an activated ability of Equipment cards.
702.6b Equip [cost] means "[Cost]: Attach this permanent to target creature you control. Activate only as a sorcery."

keywords.name: Cycling
keywords.summary: Discard this card and pay cost to draw a card
keywords.rules_text: Pay the cycling cost and discard this card to draw a card. This lets you turn an unwanted card into something new, making your deck more consistent.
keywords.reminder_text: (Cycling [cost]: Discard this card: Draw a card.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.28a Cycling is an activated ability that functions only while the card with cycling is in a player's hand.
702.28b Cycling [cost] means "[Cost], Discard this card: Draw a card."

keywords.name: Flashback
keywords.summary: Cast this card from your graveyard, then exile it
keywords.rules_text: You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. After it resolves (or is countered), exile it instead of putting it anywhere else. This gives you a second use of the spell.
keywords.reminder_text: (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules: 702.33a Flashback appears on some instants and sorceries. It represents two static abilities: one that functions while the card is in a player's graveyard and another that functions while the card is on the stack.

keywords.name: Kicker
keywords.summary: Pay extra when casting for an additional effect
keywords.rules_text: You may pay the kicker cost in addition to the spell's mana cost. If you do, the spell gets an additional or enhanced effect. Kicker is optional - you can cast the spell without it.
keywords.reminder_text: (You may pay an additional [cost] as you cast this spell.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.32a Kicker is a static ability that functions while the spell with kicker is on the stack.
702.32b "Kicker [cost]" means "You may pay an additional [cost] as you cast this spell."

keywords.name: Landfall
keywords.summary: Triggers whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control
keywords.rules_text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, this ability triggers. Playing your land for the turn triggers it, and so do fetch lands, ramp spells, and other effects that put lands onto the battlefield.
keywords.reminder_text: (Landfall - Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, [effect].)
keywords.comprehensive_rules: Landfall is an ability word that has no rules meaning. It highlights abilities that trigger whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control.

keywords.name: Prowess
keywords.summary: Gets +1/+1 until end of turn when you cast a noncreature spell
keywords.rules_text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Multiple prowess triggers from the same spell, and casting multiple spells in a turn can add up quickly.
keywords.reminder_text: (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.107a Prowess is a triggered ability.
702.107b "Prowess" means "Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn."

keywords.name: Cascade
keywords.summary: Exile cards until you hit one that costs less, cast it free
keywords.rules_text: When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom of your library in a random order.
keywords.reminder_text: (When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom in a random order.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules: 702.84a Cascade is a triggered ability that functions only while the spell with cascade is on the stack.
keywords.tips: Build decks to manipulate what you cascade into. If your only 2-drop is a combo piece, a 3-mana cascade spell always finds it.

keywords.name: Affinity
keywords.summary: Costs 1 less for each [type] you control
keywords.rules_text: This spell costs {1} less to cast for each permanent of the specified type you control. Affinity for artifacts is the most common, making cards cheaper the more artifacts you have.
keywords.reminder_text: (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each [type] you control.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.40a Affinity is a static ability that functions while the spell with affinity is on the stack.
702.40b "Affinity for [type]" means "This spell costs {1} less to cast for each [type] you control."

keywords.name: Convoke
keywords.summary: Tap creatures to help pay for this spell
keywords.rules_text: Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color. This lets you cast expensive spells quickly with a board of creatures.
keywords.reminder_text: (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.50a Convoke is a static ability that functions while the spell with convoke is on the stack.
702.50b As you cast a spell with convoke, you may tap any number of untapped creatures you control. Each creature tapped pays for {1} or one mana of a color that creature has.

keywords.name: Delve
keywords.summary: Exile cards from graveyard to pay {1} each
keywords.rules_text: Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}. Delve turns your graveyard into a mana source, making expensive spells castable very early.
keywords.reminder_text: (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.65a Delve is a static ability that functions while the spell with delve is on the stack.
702.65b As you cast a spell with delve, you may exile any number of cards from your graveyard. Each card you exile pays for {1}.
keywords.tips: Fetch lands, cantrips, and self-mill fill your graveyard quickly to enable delve.

keywords.name: Annihilator
keywords.summary: Defending player sacrifices permanents when this attacks
keywords.rules_text: Whenever this creature attacks, defending player sacrifices that many permanents. This triggers before blockers, so they lose permanents even if they chump block or kill the attacker.
keywords.reminder_text: (Whenever this creature attacks, defending player sacrifices [N] permanents.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.85a Annihilator is a triggered ability.
702.85b "Annihilator N" means "Whenever this creature attacks, defending player sacrifices N permanents."

keywords.name: Infect
keywords.summary: Deals damage as -1/-1 counters and poison counters
keywords.rules_text: This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters. A player with 10 or more poison counters loses the game.
keywords.reminder_text: (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.89a Infect is a static ability.
702.89b Damage dealt to a player by a source with infect doesn't cause that player to lose life. Instead, it causes the player to get that many poison counters.
702.89c Damage dealt to a creature by a source with infect isn't marked on that creature. Instead, it causes that many -1/-1 counters to be put on that creature.

keywords.name: Proliferate
keywords.summary: Add a counter to any number of permanents/players with counters
keywords.rules_text: Choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there. Works with +1/+1 counters, loyalty counters, poison counters, and more.
keywords.reminder_text: (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules: 701.27a To proliferate means to choose any number of permanents and/or players that have one or more counters, then give each one additional counter of each kind that permanent or player already has.

keywords.name: Scry
keywords.summary: Look at top cards, put any on bottom in any order
keywords.rules_text: Look at the top N cards of your library. Put any number on the bottom of your library in any order and the rest on top in any order. Scry helps you find what you need and avoid what you don't.
keywords.reminder_text: (Look at the top N cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules: 701.18a To scry N means to look at the top N cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library in any order and the rest on top of your library in any order.

keywords.name: Surveil
keywords.summary: Look at top cards, put any into graveyard
keywords.rules_text: Look at the top N cards of your library. Put any number into your graveyard and the rest on top in any order. Like scry, but cards go to graveyard instead of bottom, fueling graveyard strategies.
keywords.reminder_text: (Look at the top N cards of your library, then put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest on top of your library in any order.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules: 701.42a To surveil N means to look at the top N cards of your library, then put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest on top of your library in any order.

keywords.name: Mill
keywords.summary: Put top cards of library into graveyard
keywords.rules_text: To mill N cards means to put the top N cards of your library into your graveyard. If you're milled and can't draw a card when required, you lose the game.
keywords.reminder_text: (To mill a card, put the top card of your library into your graveyard.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules: 701.13a To mill a number of cards, a player puts that many cards from the top of their library into their graveyard.

keywords.name: Transform
keywords.summary: Turn this card over to its other face
keywords.rules_text: Double-faced cards have two faces. When a card transforms, it turns over to show its other face. The card remains on the battlefield but with different characteristics.
keywords.reminder_text: (This card has two faces. When it transforms, turn it over.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules: 701.28a To transform a permanent means to turn it to its other face. Only permanents represented by transforming double-faced cards can transform.

keywords.name: Protection
keywords.summary: Can't be damaged, enchanted, blocked, or targeted by [quality]
keywords.rules_text: Protection from [quality] means: Damage from sources with that quality is prevented. Can't be enchanted/equipped by permanents with that quality. Can't be blocked by creatures with that quality. Can't be targeted by spells/abilities with that quality. Remember: DEBT (Damage, Enchant/Equip, Block, Target).
keywords.reminder_text: (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything [quality].)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.16a Protection is a static ability, written "Protection from [quality]." This quality is usually a color or a card type.
702.16b A permanent with protection from [quality] can't be targeted by spells with that quality or abilities from sources with that quality.
keywords.tips: DEBT helps remember what protection does: Damage prevented, Enchant/Equip prevented, Blocking prevented, Targeting prevented.

keywords.name: Shroud
keywords.summary: Can't be targeted by spells or abilities (including yours)
keywords.rules_text: This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities. Unlike hexproof, this includes your own spells - you can't buff or equip creatures with shroud.
keywords.reminder_text: (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.18a Shroud is a static ability.
702.18b A permanent with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.
keywords.tips: Shroud was largely replaced by hexproof, which is more player-friendly since you can still target your own creatures.

keywords.name: Enrage
keywords.summary: Triggers whenever this creature is dealt damage
keywords.rules_text: Whenever this creature is dealt damage, the enrage ability triggers. This includes combat damage, direct damage, and even damage from effects you control.
keywords.reminder_text: (Whenever this creature is dealt damage, [effect].)
keywords.comprehensive_rules: Enrage is an ability word with no rules meaning. It highlights abilities that trigger whenever a creature is dealt damage.

keywords.name: Escape
keywords.summary: Cast from graveyard by exiling other cards from your graveyard
keywords.rules_text: You may cast this card from your graveyard for its escape cost. As an additional cost, exile the required number of other cards from your graveyard. Cards with escape often get bonuses when escaping.
keywords.reminder_text: (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its escape cost.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules: 702.137a Escape represents a static ability that functions while the card with escape is in a player's graveyard.

keywords.name: Partner
keywords.summary: Can have two commanders if both have partner
keywords.rules_text: If you have two commanders with partner, their combined color identity determines your deck's colors. Partner with [name] restricts which cards can pair together.
keywords.reminder_text: (You can have two commanders if both have partner.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.123a Partner is an ability that changes the rules for deck construction in the Commander variant.
702.123b Your deck may have two commanders if both have partner.
keywords.tips: Partner significantly expands deck-building options in Commander, giving access to more colors and abilities.

keywords.name: Companion
keywords.summary: Start the game with this card outside your deck if conditions met
keywords.rules_text: If your deck meets the companion's condition, you may pay {3} to put it into your hand from outside the game once per game. Companions provide a guaranteed card at the cost of deck-building restrictions.
keywords.reminder_text: (If this card is your chosen companion, you may put it into your hand from outside the game for {3} any time you could cast a sorcery.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.139a Companion is a keyword ability that functions outside the game.
702.139b Before the game begins, you may reveal one card you own from outside the game with a companion ability whose condition is satisfied by your starting deck.
keywords.tips: The errata requiring {3} to add companion to hand was added to balance these powerful cards.

keywords.name: Adventure
keywords.summary: Cast as a sorcery/instant first, then cast as creature later
keywords.rules_text: You may cast the Adventure part (shown on the left side) first. When it resolves, the card goes to exile instead of the graveyard. You can then cast the creature from exile.
keywords.reminder_text: (Cast this sorcery/instant first, then exile this card. You may cast the creature later from exile.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules: 715.3 As an adventurer card resolves, instead of being put into its owner's graveyard, it is exiled. For as long as that card remains exiled, its owner may cast the creature.

keywords.name: Mutate
keywords.summary: Combine with another creature to create a merged creature
keywords.rules_text: Cast for mutate cost, targeting a non-Human creature you own. Put this card over or under that creature. The resulting creature has the characteristics of the topmost card plus all abilities from cards beneath it.
keywords.reminder_text: (If you cast this spell for its mutate cost, put it over or under target non-Human creature you own. They mutate into the creature on top plus all abilities from under it.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.139a Mutate appears on some creature cards.
702.139b As you cast a spell with mutate, if you pay the mutate cost, you choose a target non-Human creature you own.

keywords.name: Foretell
keywords.summary: Exile face-down for {2}, cast later for foretell cost
keywords.rules_text: During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card face down. On a later turn, you may cast it for its foretell cost. This lets you pay mana over multiple turns.
keywords.reminder_text: (During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card from your hand face down. Cast it on a later turn for its foretell cost.)
keywords.comprehensive_rules:
702.142a Foretell is a keyword that represents two static abilities.
702.142b During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile a card with foretell from your hand face down.

keywords.name: Treasure
keywords.summary: Artifact token that sacrifices for one mana of any color
keywords.rules_text: Treasure tokens are artifact tokens with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color." They're a flexible mana source that counts as artifacts for synergies.
keywords.reminder_text: (Treasure is an artifact token with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
keywords.comprehensive_rules: 111.10 A Treasure token is a colorless Treasure artifact token with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color."
keywords.tips: Treasures count as artifacts, so they trigger abilities that care about artifacts entering/leaving the battlefield.

keywords.name: Food
keywords.summary: Artifact token that sacrifices for 3 life
keywords.rules_text: Food tokens are artifact tokens with "{2}, {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: You gain 3 life." They provide steady life gain and count as artifacts for synergies.
keywords.reminder_text: (Food is an artifact token with "{2}, {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: You gain 3 life.")
keywords.comprehensive_rules: 111.10 A Food token is a colorless Food artifact token with "{2}, {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: You gain 3 life."

keywords.name: Clue
keywords.summary: Artifact token that sacrifices to draw a card
keywords.rules_text: Clue tokens are artifact tokens with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card." They provide card advantage and count as artifacts for synergies.
keywords.reminder_text: (Clue is an artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
keywords.comprehensive_rules: 111.10 A Clue token is a colorless Clue artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card."

categories.combat: Keywords that affect how creatures fight
categories.protection: Keywords that protect permanents or players
categories.timing: Keywords that affect when you can cast spells
categories.activated: Keywords representing abilities you pay to activate
categories.triggered: Keywords that trigger when conditions are met
categories.graveyard: Keywords that interact with the graveyard
